documents.t: Meshnology was born from a group of passionate makers, engineers, and tinkerers who sought to redefine open-source hardware. What started as a workshop of exploration has now become a movement towards accessible and limitless innovation
In this page, you will find detailed information about our product - N30.

The WiFi LoRa 32 is a well-known IoT development board created by Heltec Automation. Since its release in 2017, it has been popular among developers and makers. The new V3 version keeps the same pin layout as the V2 and continues to support Wi-Fi, Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), LoRa, and an OLED display. This board is ideal for applications in smart cities, smart farming, home automation, industrial control, security systems, wireless metering, and general IoT development.

Equipped with an ESP32-S3FN8 microprocessor, featuring a dual-core Xtensa¬Æ 32-bit LX7 CPU, five-stage pipeline, and clock speed up to 240 MHz. Integrated SX1262 LoRa chip for long-range wireless communication. USB Type-C interface with built-in voltage regulation, ESD protection, short-circuit protection, RF shielding, and other safety features. Includes an SH1.25-2 battery connector and a built-in lithium battery management system that supports charging, discharging, overcharge protection, battery level monitoring, and automatic power switching between USB and battery. Features a 0.96-inch OLED display (128√ó64 resolution) for showing debug info, battery status, and more. Supports Wi-Fi, LoRa, and Bluetooth connectivity. Comes with a built-in 2.4GHz metal spring antenna for Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, and a reserved IPEX (U.FL) port for LoRa. Uses the CP2102 USB-to-serial chip, making it easy to upload code and view debug output. Compatible with the Arduino development environment for quick and flexible programming. Designed with a high-quality RF circuit and low power consumption for efficient operation.

Parameters Description Master Chip ESP32-S3FN8 (Xtensa¬Æ32-bit lx7 dual core processor) LoRa Node Chip SX1262 USB to Serial Chip CP2102 Frequency 470-510MHz, 863-928MHz Max. TX Power 21¬±1dBm Max. Receiving sensitivity -134dBm@SF12 BW=125KHz Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, up to 150Mbps Bluetooth Bluetooth 5 (LE) Hardware Resource 7 * ADC, 2 * ADC2, 7 * Touch,3 * UART, 2 * I2C, 2 * SPI, etc.. Memory 384KB ROM, 512KB SRAM, 16KB RTC SRAM, 8MB SiP Flash Interface Type-C USB, 2 * 1.25 battery interface, LoRa ANT(IPEX1.0), 2 * 18 * 2.54 Header Pin Battery 3.7V lithium battery power supply and charging Operating Temperature -20 ~ 70 ‚ÑÉ Dimensions 50.2 * 25.5* 10.2 mm

Region/Country Frequency Band (MHz) Notes European Union (EU) 868 MHz Common channels: 868.1, 868.3, 868.5 MHz; subject to duty cycle limits United Kingdom (UK) 868 MHz Follows EU868 plan; ISM band use with duty cycle & ERP limitations United States (US) 902‚Äì928 MHz No duty cycle limit; wide channel availability China (CN) 470‚Äì510 MHz, 779‚Äì787 MHz Mostly uses 470‚Äì510 MHz; region-specific restrictions India (IN) 865‚Äì867 MHz License-free band; commonly used for LoRaWAN Australia (AU) 915‚Äì928 MHz Similar to US, but with different sub-band/channel plans South Korea (KR) 920‚Äì923 MHz Requires compliance with Korean radio regulations Japan (JP) 920‚Äì928 MHz Must comply with ARIB standards Southeast Asia (e.g., Thailand, Malaysia) 920‚Äì925 MHz Band varies slightly by country Russia (RU) 864‚Äì870 MHz Similar to EU868; local licensing may apply South America (e.g., Brazil) 902‚Äì907.5 & 915‚Äì928 MHz US-like band plan, but with some central frequencies restricted

LoRaWAN defines regional profiles such as EU868, US915, IN865, etc. Transmission power, channel bandwidth, and duty cycle regulations vary by country. Always ensure hardware certification (e.g., FCC, CE, MIC) and compliance with local laws.

India: Use 865‚Äì867 MHz band for license-free applications like smart metering, logistics, and agriculture. UK & EU: LoRa modules supporting 868 MHz can be deployed under ISM band rules with proper duty cycle compliance.
This platform is aimed at sharing knowledges and practices
documents.s: Welcome to Meshnology Wiki & Code Lab

documents.t: It all started in a small workshop cluttered with wires, circuit boards, and endless cups of coffee. A group of makers, tinkerers, and engineers sat around a table, not just discussing technology‚Äîbut reimagining it. We weren‚Äôt satisfied with just using hardware; we wanted to create it, improve it, and most importantly, share it. That‚Äôs when we discovered RoLa open-source hardware‚Äîa system full of potential, waiting to be explored. But we didn‚Äôt stop at using it. We saw a new horizon, a chance to push the boundaries of open-source design and make something uniquely ours. And so, Meshnology was born.

Our journey wasn‚Äôt smooth. There were nights spent debugging circuits that refused to cooperate, days when prototypes failed spectacularly, and moments of doubt. But every failure was a lesson, every challenge an opportunity. We weren‚Äôt just building products‚Äîwe were laying the foundation for a new era of open-source innovation. Today, Meshnology stands for more than just hardware. It represents a belief that technology should be accessible, adaptable, and limitless. Our products are not just tools; they are invitations‚Äîfor makers, students, engineers, and dreamers‚Äîto take what we‚Äôve built and make it even better.

We don‚Äôt create for the sake of selling. We create to inspire. To push the limits of what‚Äôs possible. To transform makers into innovators. Welcome to Meshnology. The future is open, and it‚Äôs yours to build.

At the Meshnology store, we offer LoRa protocol-based node products, including our flagship N30 series. This series provides a complete solution‚Äîenclosure, battery, and antenna‚Äîfor nodes like the Heltec WiFi & LoRa V3, making it easier for makers to apply LoRa technology in Meshtatics and IoT applications. Of course, the enclosures and batteries in the N30 series are also available separately, giving makers greater flexibility for DIY projects. In addition, we sell products independently developed by the Meshnology team, such as load testers and keypad modules, to support a comprehensive product ecosystem for the maker community.

Meshnology was born from a group of passionate makers, engineers, and tinkerers who sought to redefine open-source hardware. What started as a workshop of exploration has now become a movement towards accessible and limitless innovation You can find information about Meshnology‚Äôs N30 series for LoRa communication products, example code, and case studies in the Meshnology Wiki & Code Lab. It also features resources and sample programs for the Heltec ESP32 LoRa V3 development board, the RAK19007 WisBlock Base, and the RAK4631 module.

Official Product Name by Heltec: WiFi LoRa 32(V3), ESP32S3 + SX1262 LoRa Node, Meshtastic and LoRaWAN Compatible Pinmap, demo codes For LoRa 32(V3) Board

In this page, you will find detailed information about our product - N30. The N30 is the first maker-focused product developed by our Meshnology team, specifically designed for the Heltec LoRa V3 Node. It features a newly engineered, compact 3D-printed protective case along with a built-in 1100mAh battery. Despite its small footprint, the N30 seamlessly integrates both the Heltec LoRa V3 Node and the battery, achieving optimal balance between size and weight. It delivers a complete, ready-to-deploy solution for LoRa applications in outdoor environments.

From a structural perspective, the Meshnology N30 Kit mainly includes: Heltec WiFi & LoRa V3 Node with OLED Display * 1 3D-Printed Protective Case * 1 1100mAh Battery * 1 Antenna * 2 Below is the information for each component.
Since the Heltec WiFi & LoRa V3 Node is a standalone product from Heltec, we have placed it in a dedicated section. Jump to Resources For Heltec WiFi & LoRa V3 Node
Order: Pruchase Link Dimensions‚Äã Color Option: Black/Red Size: 3.2cm x 2.9cm x 6.3cm (1.26 in x 1.14 in x 2.48 in) Weight: 17g

Order: Pruchase Link Dimensions‚Äã Parameter Data Capacity 1100mAh Model 102540 Voltage 3.7V Cell Configuration 1S Discharge Rate 3C Connector Micro JST 1.25 Protection: Dual Protection Circuit Board (PCB) Included Certification If you have purchased our battery and need the certification documents, please contact us at: support@meshnology.com. We will send them to you.
In this standard N30 kit, there are 2 different antennas: Stick antenna * 1 Soft whip antenna * 1 Frequency: 915 MHz What's the LoRa frequency band in my Country/Region?
